page.title: 19BEAFORD METHODIST CHURCH
page.content: The Methodist Church was built in the 1820's and was a Church of the Bible Christian movement which began at Shebbear in 1815. The Beaford Methodist Church became part of the United Methodist connection in 1907. A schoolroom was built on in 1869; a small cottage is maintained for the use of the caretaker. Interior improvements have been made from time to time, but the main building remains in its original form. Beaford Methodist Church belongs to the Hatherleigh Methodist circuit, and is served by 2 ministers. These are assisted by local preachers who often take the Sunday services. At present this church has 33 members; the Sunday School has 8 children attending regularly. Accommodation will seat 150 people.
